application_type_full: Full planning & demolition in a conservation area
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents: 245/001 Rev P3 (Site Location Plan), 245/010 Rev P2 (Existing Site Plan), 245/011 Rev P2 (Existing Plans: Lower Ground Floor), 245/012 Rev P2 (Existing Plans: Ground Floor), 245/013 Rev P2 (Existing Plans: First Floor), 245/014 Rev P2 (Existing Plans: Second Floor), 245/015 Rev P2 (Existing Plans: Roof), 245/020 Rev P4 (Existing Elevation A & B), 245/021 Rev P4 (Existing Elevations C & D), 245/022 Rev P2 (Existing Section E & F), 245/040 Rev P6 (Proposed Site Plan), 245/041 Rev P5 (Proposed Plans: Lower Ground Floor), 245/042 Rev P6 (Proposed Plans: Ground Floor), 245/043 Rev P5 (Proposed Plans: First Floor), 245/044 Rev P5 (Proposed Plans: Second Floor), 245/045 Rev P5 (Proposed Plans: Roof), 245/050 Rev P6 (Proposed Elevation A), 245/051 Rev P7 (Proposed Elevation B), 245/052 Rev P6 (Proposed Elevation C), 245/053 Rev P7 (Proposed Section E), 245/054 Rev P6 (Proposed Elevation D), 245/055 Rev P2 (Proposed Section F), 245/060 Rev P5 (Existing and Proposed Gross Internal Floor Areas), 245/070 Rev P2 (Existing Site Demolition Plan), 245/071 Rev P2 (Existing Basement Demolition Plan), 245/072 Rev P2 (Existing Ground Floor Demolition Plan), 245/073 Rev P2 (Existing First Floor Demolition Plan), 245/074 Rev P2 (Existing Second Floor Demolition Plan), 245/075 Rev P2 (Existing Roof Demolition Plan), 245/080 Rev P2 (Existing Elevation A&B - Demolition), 245/081 Rev P2 (Existing Elevation C & D - Demolition), 245/082 Rev P2 (Existing Section E & F - Demolition), Design & Access Statement Rev P5 dated November 2021, Materials Schedule for 18 Mount Park Crescent prepared by TFF Architects Issued 09.11.2021, Construction Method Statement prepared by JG Partnership (dated September 2021, reference RW 270 Issue 01), Construction Management Plan and Excavation Method Statement prepared by More & Co. Ltd., Demolition Method Statement (Safe System of Work), Sustainability and Energy Statement prepared by Maven Sustainability dated 7th September 2021, Basement Impact Assessment - New Build Scheme Rev 1 prepared by CGL Providing Ground Solutions (dated August 2021 ref CGL/09677 Rev 1), Heritage Statement prepared by Authentic Futures dated August 2021, Arboricultural Impact Assessment prepared by Aspect Arboriculture (ref: 10835_AIA.001 Rev B), and Arboricultural Method Statement prepared by Aspect Arboriculture (dated September 2021, ref: 10835_AMS.002).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall match those described in the approved drawings and documents listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the special character of the Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and the Mount Park Conservation Area Management Plan. | The hereby approved rooflights to the roof slopes of the dwelling shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | No part of the roof of the development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Prior to the commencement of the development, the tree protection measures outlined in the Arboricultural Method Statement prepared by Aspect Arboriculture (dated September 2021, ref: 10835_AMS.002) shall be fully implemented on site.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior consent of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained in writing.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Ealing SPG 9, policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies SI 1, SI 2 and G7 of the London Plan (2021). | No trees, shrubs or hedges within, or in proximity of, the site shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any trees, shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Ealing SPG 9, policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies SI 1, SI 2 and G7 of the London Plan (2021). | The development shall be carried out in accordance with the mitigation measures and drainage strategies identified in Basement Impact Assessment - New Build Scheme Rev 1 prepared by CGL Providing Ground Solutions (dated August 2021 ref CGL/09677 Rev 1).

Reason: To reduce surface water run-off and the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy), policies D10, SI 12 and SI 13 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021). | The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details and control measures outlined in Construction Method Statement prepared by JG Partnership (dated September 2021, reference RW 270 Issue 01) and Construction Management Plan and Excavation Method Statement prepared by More & Co. Ltd.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with  policies 7A, 7B and 7.15 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies D6, D10, D14, SI1, T3 and T7 of the London Plan (2021), the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density.
description: Construction of a two storey, six bedroom dwelling house (following partial demolition of existing building with retention of existing front facade); decorative gable to front elevation at roof level; two storey projecting bay window to front elevation; excavation to provide basement level, including lightwells to front and rear elevation; alterations to front boundary wall including installation of metal gates; alterations to side (south) boundary treatment; and raised rear terrace and associated privacy screens.
